content: never better socks sizes| child small medium large 7-8 8-9 9-10 10-11 measurements are based on foot circumference around the widest point on the foot socks are super flexible so just get as close as possible i recommend a size that has at least 1 inch of negative ease for the best fit yarn| fingering weight/sock yarn ideally something with at least 15% nylon needles| us 1 / 2 25 mm or size needed to obtain gauge this pattern is written using 9 inch circs but can easily be knit with any other method gauge| approx 8 stitches per inch in stockinette @madebymaddie33 www youtube knit 2 together pm| place marker ssk| slip slip knit 2 slipped stitches together sm| slip marker p2tog| purl 2 together sizing if you feel like you or the lucky person you are knitting for are between sizes you can knit a half size between any of these by doing a little bit of math i ll show you how i would adjust for 68 sts cast on and knit the leg as normal with 68 sts on the needle if you are doing 2 by 2 ribbing you just want to be sure you cast on a multiple of 4 work the heel flap on half of the stitches 68/2=34 set up your heel turn using ¼ of the stitches 68/4=17 heel turn row 1 would be as follows sl1 k17 ssk k1 turn using dk yarn if you want to knit a fingering weight pattern on dk yarn my rule of thumb is to go up two needle sizes and down two pattern sizes i typically knit socks on a us 1 with 64 sts for dk i knit on a us 3 with 48 sts resources german twisted cast on | https //www youtube com/watch v=ucwmcuiylii joining in the round | https //www youtube com/watch
